SEARCH
Module JBubbleBobble
Package game.model

Class HelpMethods

java.lang.Object
game.model.HelpMethods
public class HelpMethods extends Object
The HelpMethods class provides utility methods related to level physics, collisions, and entity movements. These methods help determine whether an entity can move to a specific location or if an entity is colliding with solid tiles in the game world. The class includes functions to check if an entity is inside a wall, grounded, or adjusting its position to fit under a roof or above the floor.

      public HelpMethods()

  • Method Details

    • canMoveHere

      public static boolean canMoveHere(float x, float y, float width, float height)
      Checks if an entity can move to a given position. It verifies that no part of the entity's bounding box (defined by x, y, width, and height) intersects with solid tiles.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the entity's top-left corner.
      y - The y-coordinate of the entity's top-left corner.
      width - The width of the entity.
      height - The height of the entity.
      Returns:
      true if the entity can move to the specified position without intersecting solid tiles, false otherwise.

    • isSolid

      private static boolean isSolid(float x, float y)
      Determines if the specified position (x, y) is a solid tile. The method checks if the coordinates are within the boundaries of the level and checks the level data to see if the tile is marked as solid.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate to check.
      y - The y-coordinate to check.
      Returns:
      true if the position is solid, false otherwise.

    • isEntityInsideWall

      public static boolean isEntityInsideWall(Entity entity)
      Checks whether the entity is inside a wall. This method checks if any corner of the entity's bounding box intersects with solid tiles.
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity to check.
      Returns:
      true if the entity is inside a wall, false otherwise.

    • isEntityInsideWall

      public static boolean isEntityInsideWall(float x, float y, float width, float height)
      Checks if an entity (defined by x, y, width, and height) intersects with any solid tiles.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the top-left corner of the entity.
      y - The y-coordinate of the top-left corner of the entity.
      width - The width of the entity.
      height - The height of the entity.
      Returns:
      true if the entity is inside a wall, false otherwise.

    • isEntityGrounded

      public static boolean isEntityGrounded(MovingEntity movingEntity)
      Checks if the moving entity is grounded, meaning it is standing on a solid tile. The method verifies that at least one pixel along the bottom of the entity's bounding box (i.e., just below the entity's feet) is solid. Additionally, the method ensures that the row of pixels directly above the entity's feet is non-solid to ensure that the entity is not inside a wall.
      Parameters:
      movingEntity - The entity to check.
      Returns:
      true if the entity is grounded, false otherwise.

    • isSolidHorizontalLine

      public static boolean isSolidHorizontalLine(float x1, float x2, float y)
      Checks if any pixel along a horizontal line is solid, used for determining collisions along a horizontal path.
      Parameters:
      x1 - The starting x-coordinate of the line.
      x2 - The ending x-coordinate of the line.
      y - The y-coordinate of the line.
      Returns:
      true if any pixel along the line is solid, false otherwise.

    • isSolidVerticalLine

      public static boolean isSolidVerticalLine(float x, float y1, float y2)
      Checks if any pixel along a vertical line is solid, used for determining collisions along a vertical path.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the line.
      y1 - The starting y-coordinate of the line.
      y2 - The ending y-coordinate of the line.
      Returns:
      true if any pixel along the line is solid, false otherwise.
